If anyone interested to answer this question :)

<https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jaydipjsuvagiya_developer-activity-7231957425816272896-Q9Hu>

:wave: Hi everyone! if anyone has previous experience, any information would be helpful.
We use the form plugin - Quform in our projects. When the user fills out a letter, letters that have not passed the validation of the email field on the site are sent to the HubSpot. How can it be fixed so that letters that have not passed validation - email fields are not sent to the HubSpot?

If you’re a HubSpot expert, take a look at <https://www.pocketpros.io|pocketpros.io> to set up your expert profile.

I’ve spent most of my career working in HubSpot; agency side, in-house, and now as a HubSpot freelancer.
I created pocketpros, a HubSpot experts directory, with a simple goal in mind - to help companies who use HubSpot to find experts more easily, and to help fellow HubSpotters connect and potentially collaborate on projects.

It doesn’t matter if you’re a part of the HubSpot partner program or simply just a freelancer who specialises in HubSpot. This directory is for all experts who have amazing HubSpot skills.

If you’re interested in signing up please go ahead! Or if you have any questions let me know! :slightly_smiling_face:

Matt :wave:
hii can someone solve my problem regarding cta styling . i am unable to style my popup cta and having problem with responsive is there a way to add custom css to popup cta
Share some markup and the styling, easier to tell what might be the issue

Good morning! Is it possible to use a calculation property for this in HubSpot?

All of the below properties output as currency with the exception of `Status` which is a dropdown select with two values: Full-Time, or Part-Time.

We run a staffing firm and use HubSpot for both sales & applicant tracking. Can we have a calculation property (let's call it `Combined Revenue` ) that sets itself to either one of two values. `Combined Revenue` sets itself to the value of property `Monthly Pay` ONLY if `Status` = Full-Time, or have `Combined Revenue`  set itself to the value of property `Total Hourly Pay` ONLY if `Status`  = Part-Time.

If it makes it easier -- `Monthly Pay`  only has a value when `Status` = Full-Time (and then `Total Hourly Pay` 's value is empty.) Same thing in reverse: `Total Hourly Pay`  only has a value if `Status` = Part-Time (and then `Monthly Pay` 's value is empty)

For anyone wondering, thanks to a solution provided by <@U01QVR44MEY>, i was able to solve it. My issue was that the signature module was not present in the print view. However, that is essential for HelloSign/Dropbox Sign to run without that Error.  Without <@U01QVR44MEY>´s tip i would have never solved this issue.

<@UJJ239SC9>

Thank you so much!  This is solution worked PERFECTLY!
this cta is not responsive for mobile how i can responsive. is there  a way to add css in cta ?

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
i am unavailable to get date constraints named custom object by using its name anyone please tell me the correct object name for this

Hey <@U07JC7M1D08>, we don’t offer direct support in this Slack, it’s a community for developers building on HubSpot to collaborate and share ideas. I’d suggest you take a look at <http://help.HubSpot.com|help.HubSpot.com> and report this bug directly to our support team. Thank you!
